Animation of robot showing how to activate Roomba, indicating the location of Spot and Home buttons needed to activate Roomba. For Series 900 Roombas the Home button is left of the large Clean button; the Spot button is right of the large Clean button. For Series 600 and 800 Roombas the Spot button is the semi-arc button above the large Clean button; the Home button is the semi-arc button below the large Clean button. Press and hold both Spot and Home buttons for two seconds.

We are continually improving our iRobot Home app experience. To access our enhanced services, such as Amazon Alexa™, please take a moment to create an iRobot account.
Please take a moment to create an account to enable enhanced services, such as Amazon Alexa™ integration.
As we improve our privacy practices, we will no longer allow multiple accounts to control robots. Please confirm that you would like to register your iRobot products with the following account:
This will block the other %d account owners from accessing your iRobot products. Before continuing, let them know this is happening!

Imprint™ Smart Mapping allows your robot to create and store a map of your home in the cloud. With this feature you can send your robot to clean individual rooms or an entire floor, all from the iRobot Home app.
Users who have already created an account on iRobot.com, please use your original email on file so we can seamlessly link your existing account to the new system.

iRobot takes your security and privacy concerns very seriously. We put you in control of your data and access to your connected robot. By creating an iRobot Home account, you register and associate your robot with you and only you. Connected robots store their operating data, such as Clean Map™ reports, in the iRobot Cloud. Within the iRobot Home app, you can choose to disable the upload and saving of the Clean Map reports. Your iRobot Home account also enables linking between robots and connected home products.
Press and hold the Spot @img and Home @img buttons on the robot simultaneously for 2 seconds and then release. You will hear a sound.

"The new iRobot Home App is here. With it, enhanced maps, the ability to clean specific objects, custom routines, seasonal suggestions, and intuitive smart home integrations*. Every aspect of the iRobot Home App has been redesigned to give you ultimate control over your clean.
* Feature availability varies by robot model
YOUR LIFE. YOUR HOME. YOUR CLEAN: Unlock a cleaning experience designed around you. Create cleaning schedules, save favorites, and adjust them on the fly. Get personalized cleaning recommendations based on what’s happening in your home, and even tell your robots to clean while you’re away with smart home integration. Turn cleaning from something you do to something that happens around your life.
CLEANING, CONTROLLED: Customizable maps of your home enable your robots to go to the mess, cleaning by room, object, or area while staying away from Keep Out Zones*.
* Feature availability varies by robot model
ADAPT TO YOUR SCHEDULE: Use Automations to connect to your smart devices and personalize your cleaning experience by scheduling your robot to clean when you leave the house.
CLEAN WITHOUT LIFTING A FINGER: Keep doing what you’re doing! All connected robots are compatible with select voice assistants so you can clean with your voice*.
*Works with Google Assistant and Alexa enabled devices *Alexa and all related logos are trademarks of Amazon.com or its affiliates. *Google is a trademark of Google LLC
ALWAYS GETTING SMARTER: Your robot will stay up to date with automatic software updates.
REQUIREMENTS: • Wi-Fi® connected Roomba® 900, 600, 800 and e Series vacuuming robot models only support Wi-Fi® networks with 2.4GHz band • Roomba® i Series robots support both Wi-Fi® networks with 2.4GHz and 5GHz band • Braava jet™ 240 mopping robot uses Bluetooth Low Energy (also known as BLE or Bluetooth Smart) built in to most common mobile devices"

"We couldn't add you to iRobot BETA right now. Please check your network connection and try again later."
"We're working on new BETA features for you to explore, but they're not quite ready yet. Check back often and be the first to test out the latest and greatest!"

"

Set up Do Not Disturb to block your robot from cleaning during certain times such as during weekly meetings, nap time, bed time, and more.

During these times:

  • Automations will not be able to start
  • Active cleaning jobs will end
  • All robot sounds will be silenced during an active Do Not Disturb
  • You can still start one-time jobs and create schedules from the app. You'll get a reminder letting you know if it overlaps with a Do Not Disturb
  • You can still use the robot's physical button to start new jobs
  • You can still use clean by voice with Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant

"

"1. Enable this feature.
2. Go to Smart Home > Do Not Disturb from the 3-line menu in the top left of the app.
3. Turn on, edit, or delete the default suggested Do Not Disturb time, or create a new one unique to your needs."

iRobot values your privacy and will only use your map data to provide a more personalized cleaning and smart home experience and to improve your smart home products over time. View more in our Privacy policy.

"Enabling this functionality will update your future Clean Maps to include connected devices on your home Wi-fi network and Bluetooth devices in the robot’s vicinity. You’ll be able to visualize your smart home at a glance and gather information that might be helpful when customizing your Smart Map.
As your robot cleans, it will detect and collect the wireless signal strengths of each device connected to your home network and non-private Bluetooth devices within range. Estimated locations of detected devices will appear on your next Clean Map for your reference.
By testing this experimental mapping function, you'll be joining other technically-inclined robot owners in our product development process and playing an important role in new robot features."

"1. Enable this feature.
2. Send your robot out to do a “Clean All”.
3. Estimated locations of your connected devices will appear on your Clean Map when the cleaning job completes."

"Since you will be one of the first people to see this new BETA feature in action, we would love to hear your feedback. Take a look at the Message Center to answer a couple of short questions about your experience with the iRobot Home app so far, and stay tuned for occasional follow-ups as you get a chance to explore the BETA. We really appreciate your time and opinions, so thank you in advance from the team! "

"As your robot cleans, it can detect wireless signal strength throughout your home to highlight areas with poor connection on the Wi-Fi® Coverage Map¹.
To enable your Wi-Fi® Coverage Map, you'll need a Roomba® 900 series robot vacuum with Clean Map™ Reports toggled ON and robot software 2.4 or greater. To verify this, go to the Home screen, select the More icon, and then review Settings."
¹ Wi-Fi® is a registered mark of the Wi-Fi Alliance.

"1. Simply start your Roomba® robot vacuum on a cleaning job to begin gathering Wi-Fi® signal information.
2. Upon completion of the cleaning job, the app will render a Wi-Fi® Coverage Map of your home.
3. To view your Wi-Fi® Coverage Map, navigate to the Clean Map™ Report screen and tap Wi-Fi® Map."
"Learn more about the Wi-Fi® signal strength in your home. You'll need a Roomba® 900 series robot vacuum."

%s will not start any new cleaning jobs and will pause existing ones if it detects its bin is full.

"Roomba senses when its dust bin is full. There are two options for what Roomba should do when the bin is full.
1) Finish Job: Even if the bin is full, Roomba will continue cleaning until it has covered the entire space. Once the bin is emptied, Roomba is ready for a new cleaning job.
2) Pause Immediately: As soon as bin is full, Roomba will return to where it started and pause its cleaning job. Once the bin is emptied, press clean to resume.
The behavior is \"Finish Job\" by default.
Note that, if the bin full light comes on at any time during a cleaning job, you can always pause the cleaning job to empty the bin and then continue cleaning.
This setting is applicable for regular and scheduled cleaning jobs."
%s will not start any new cleaning jobs if it detects its bin is full. If the bin becomes full while %s is cleaning, it will still complete that job.
%s will start and complete cleaning jobs even when it detects its bin is full.

"What's New - Improved Clean Map(TM) Reports now show where dirt was detected for Roomba 900 and i7 series robots. - Improved workflow for customizing your Smart Map(TM) *(Roomba i7 series only).* - New Message Center for U.S. customers - Bug fixes and performance improvements"

"- Imprint Link support for Roomba 900 series robots (requires m6) - Smart Map editing improvements (i7, s9 and m6) - Care & Maintenance Redesign - Account related user-experience improvements - iOS 13 support - Keep Out Zones support for Roomba i7, s9 and Braava jet m6. Now you can tell your robot to stay away from certain areas or objects with customizable Keep Out Zones!"
"- Smart Map editing improvements (i7, s9 and m6) - Bug fixes and performance improvements"

"- New and improved home screen and app design - Ability to create and save cleaning routines with Favorites - Ability to schedule Imprint® Link jobs - Schedule your robot to clean when you leave the house - Create Clean Zones to direct cleaning to objects and areas, including voice assistant support - Improved Smart Map education - Personalized cleaning recommendations"

"- Improved UI for devices with smaller screens - Renamed our \"Notifications\" to \"Messages\" - Fixed a delay in messages appearing in Messages - Fixed an issue that editing your Smart Map might delete your Favorite or Schedule - Added support of non-ascii characters when naming a Favorite - Additional performance improvements and bug fixes"

"- Extended favorites capabilities now rolled out to all robots! - New automation: clean when you’re away from home with phone location services enabled by IFTTT - Added 90° rotate button to the map view screen - Enhanced personalized recommendations - Increased minimum Clean Zone size - Fixed an issue where clean schedules were being removed - Fixed various map related issues"

"- New automation: clean when you’re away from home with phone location services enabled by IFTTT - Smart Home automations now available in China - Estimated time to clean shown for rooms and Clean Zones - Threshold Zones are now available for m6 - Resolved an issue with editing room dividers - Resolved some issues when using the map rotate button"

"- Room name suggestions are now available for Imprint Smart Mapping capable robots - Automation Update: Use your phone's location to tell your robot to start cleaning when you leave home, enabled by IFTTT"
"-Room name suggestions are now available for Imprint Smart Mapping capable robots -Bug fixes and improvements"
"-Initiators shown for all past cleaning jobs in history section -Bug fixes and improvements"
"- New Automation option to ‘Pause & Notify’ when you return home for in-the-moment robot control - Bug fixes and improvements"
"-New language support for Turkish -Bug fixes and improvements"

"It is possible to put your Roomba into a temporary low power suspended state, allowing your robot to consume less power when not being used, by turning off all functionality except battery charging. This may be helpful if you are not planning to use the robot for an extended period of time (for example, you are going on vacation).
When in this state, the iRobot Home App will be unable to connect to the robot and any scheduled cleanings will be suspended. Roomba will remain in this low power state until you start a cleaning job from the CLEAN button on the robot, at which point it will wake up and return to normal operation.
To put Roomba into this state, put Roomba on its Home Base and hold the SPOT button for 10 seconds. "

Once connected, you'll be able to use the iRobot HOME app to schedule your robot to clean while you're away from home, and to stop its job and go back to its charging station when you come home.
To connect to IFTTT:
1. Open the IFTTT Website or App
2. Search for \"iRobot\"
3. Tap \"Connect\" and then sign in with your iRobot account to link IFTTT to your robot"

"Simply ask the T-mall Genie to start, stop or dock your Roomba robot vacuum by following these steps:
1. Open the T-mall Genie app
2. Click on Add Device and look for iRobot
3. Click \"绑定账号\" and then sign in with your iRobot account to link to your robot"

"Connect the Yonomi app to integrate your robot with your favorite smart home devices. With Yonomi you can create automated smart home routines - like turning on the lights when your robot enters a room or pausing your robot when you unlock your front door. Follow these steps to get started:
1. Open the Yonomi App on your iOS or Android device
2. Run device discovery in the Yonomi App and connect your iRobot account
3. Create a new Routine to sync your robot with your lights, locks, and more"
Link your Google Home App to get started

Connect your iRobot account to your smart home devices to seamlessly integrate your robot’s cleaning behavior into your unique home and lifestyle. You’ll also be able to opt-in to notifications and guidance to improve your robot’s smart home capabilities based on the apps already installed in your phone. This information will never leave iRobot and is only used to personalize and streamline your smart home experience.
Receive personalized recommendations based on smart home apps installed on your device.

"In order to successfully connect Roomba to your Wi‑Fi network, please note that Roomba uses 802.11n at 2.4GHz with a 20MHz channel width. When checking your network settings, please ensure:
Radio mode = 2.4 GHz or 2.4/5 GHz mixed network.
Channel width set to 20MHz or 20MHz/40MHz.
Channel number support varies by region.
You are not using a VPN or Proxy Server.
Your router does not have Wi‑Fi isolation enabled. Guest networks have this setting as a default.
Your router supports IPv4.
Protocol = N (B/G) compatible
Network extender/repeaters must have the same name and password as the primary network.
Ensure mobile device has a strong Wi‑Fi signal in the desired Home Base location.
If you meet the above requirements and are having issues connecting, try rebooting the robot and force close the iRobot Home App and restart the setup process."

"Ensure the Home Base is plugged in.
Ensure that your Roomba is on the Home Base.
If Roomba's lights are not illuminated, press the CLEAN button to wake up the robot.
Press and hold the Home and Spot buttons on either side of the CLEAN button for two seconds when activating the robot's Wi‑Fi.
If the problem persists, restart the robot."

"If Roomba does not display in your mobile device's list of available Wi‑Fi networks during setup, please ensure the following is true.
Roomba is on the Home Base and the Wi‑Fi light is blinking.
Roomba is located within 10 ft (3 m) of your mobile device.
You have waited at least 30 seconds for your Roomba to appear in your mobile device's Wi‑Fi list.
If the problem persists, restart the robot."

"If you can select Roomba from your mobile device's Wi‑Fi network list, but your mobile device cannot connect to Roomba, go to Settings and toggle the airplane mode off and on.
If the problem persists, restart the robot."

"Press and hold the CLEAN button on the robot for 10 seconds until all the lights illuminate. When you release the button, you will hear a series of tones.
Press and release the CLEAN button once, then wait five seconds and resume previous activity."

"Press and hold the Home and Spot buttons for 10 seconds until all the lights turn off. When you release the buttons, you will hear a series of tones.
Press and release the CLEAN button once, then wait five seconds and reactivate the Roomba network."

"If the map looks significantly different from the area you have been cleaning, it is possible that there is a problem with the map that cannot be solved with an additional run.
Sometimes this is because there is not enough light for %1$s to find its way around, causing it to have trouble making a good map.
If this is the case, you can have %1$s forget this area and start learning again from scratch on the next run."

"If your map looks incomplete or is difficult to understand, try adding one more run to make sure %1$s has explored the whole space.
When adding an additional run, we recommend starting %1$s on the charging station, removing obstacles, and helping it out if it gets stuck. Make sure to let %1$s complete the entire job - even if it needs to pause to recharge halfway through."

"This is an example map. The space that %1$s has mapped is shown in dark gray. Cluttered areas (furniture and smaller obstacles) are marked in light gray.
The Home icon shows where %1$s's charging station was on the last run."

If your robot is still cleaning when you get home it will ask you if it should continue cleaning or end and go home. You can also set it to automatically end and go home.

If your robot is still cleaning when you get home it will ask you if it should complete its job or end it and go home. You can change this to have it always end without notifying in the ‘When I return home’ settings.

A factory reset of %s will return all settings and preferences to their default selections. After a factory reset, %s’s workspace will be erased, and it will be not be able to mow your yard. %s will be able to mow again only after a professional re-installation. Do not factory reset %s unless you are certain that you would like to.

Adjust your phone settings before you continue with setup.
1. Go to your phone’s Wi-Fi advanced settings.
2. Disable the Wi-Fi assistant that your Android model uses. It could be called “Smart network switch”, “Avoid poor connections” or “Switch to mobile data automatically”.
2. Scroll down to the bottom and disable Wi-Fi Assist.
3. Come back to this app and tap “Next” to continue with setup.
